text.tspan: Despite having a reputation for being weak
in the eyes of outsiders, the Nine Fingers
are formidable in battle due to their close-
combat skills and loyalty to one another. In
addition, they often employ surprise
attacks to draw their opponents into hand-
to-hand combat.
The Nine Fingers, a group of gladiators and
other individuals who fled the Fidelian
Empire, are not well-versed in firearms.
Instead, they relied on hand-to-hand
combat techniques, such as using swords,
shields, and whips, which they learned
while fighting in the empire's arenas.
The Nine Fingers, a group of
mercenaries led by Leopart the 3rd
and eight comrades, will do whatever
it takes to survive, including stealing
weapons and money, robbing other
groups, and fishing for food.
However, they are fearless in taking
risks to obtain essential supplies like
food, water, and weapons.
Leopart the 3rd, a champion gladiator, fled the
empire for freedom and joined forces with other slave
fighters in the same arena, destroying the space and
stealing weapons from the kingdom.
Gladiators were slave entertainers who
fought in the empire's arenas for the
enjoyment of the noble class. But
unfortunately, they were treated as
disposable goods and were expected to be
used up and discarded quickly.
The Nine Fingers is a group of nine
people, led by Leopart the 3rd,
who fled the Fidelian Empire. It
comprises gladiators from
Fidelian's arenas, slave workers,
and other civilians who joined
along the way.
New beginnings
Biff was always worried about being betrayed,
and the empire did not care who became the
Hunters' leader, so he did not train his
subordinates to be too strong. However, he
knew that having subordinates with very high
combat abilities could be dangerous for him,
given the nature of the missions that the
Hunters accepted from the empire.
Biff, the leader of the Hunters, and a few
other members with superior fighting
abilities, have exploited corruption to gain
power within the group. Despite this, the
majority of the Hunters struggle to
effectively use older firearms and rely on
the support of the empire.
Their leader, Biff, is accompanied by a
small group of loyal, corrupt convicts.
While the empire technically monitors
the Hunters, they have a reputation for
disregarding rules and lacking discipline.
The Fidelian Empire considers
the Hunters an invaluable part
of their military. As such, they
regularly replenished their
ranks by selecting some
enslaved people to join the
group.
However, these missions are
typically dirty or brutal tasks
that the empire cannot openly
perform, such as hunting down
escaped slaves or suppressing
survivor settlements that do
not comply with the empire's
orders. As a result, the Hunters
rely on the empire for almost
all of their funding and rarely
interact with other groups.
They receive almost all of their requests
from the empire and rely on them for
their operating funds, as they rarely
interact with other groups.
Biff, the former slave camp's
mercenary commander, is a greedy
and cunning individual previously
enslaved by the empire. However,
due to his strength and proper
manners, the kingdom recognized
him and freed him, giving him the
task of leading the Hunters.
The Hunters are typically assigned
dirty and brutal missions that the
empire cannot openly perform,
such as hunting runaway enslaved
people and suppressing survivors'
settlements that do not obey the
realm with minimal force.
The Fidelian Empire is facing a
chronic shortage of troops as it
works to strengthen the
organization.
With insufficient resources to
maintain and operate a regular
army, the empire has become
accustomed to hiring and using
understaffed soldiers.
The Hunters are an exclusive
military group tasked with
relatively simple duties.
Their weapons are mainly guns from pre-
war, obtained through looting and
procured by moving to and from the
desert. They are armed with these weapons
and have superior combat power to other
organizations.
Jack'N Boyz tends to attack first, believing they
will have the advantage in victory. However,
their fighting style is rarely used in prolonged
battles or against large numbers of trained
troops. Their success depends on being the first
to spot the enemy and the first to flee.
Each member is assigned to a subordinate unit based on their combat,
search, and procurement roles. Combat units receive preferential treatment
compared to non-combat units. While the cadres and teams are nominally
divided, Jack Grey virtually makes all decisions.
Jack'N Boyz mostly lives
in cars and motorcycles
and prefers to stay in
one place for short
periods.
As a result, many of
them have converted
camping cars or buses
into temporary living
quarters.
Mobility is a priority for Jack'N Boyz, who ride
motorcycles and drive classic Mustang-like
muscle cars. They dress in long, dark coats and
hats, with tiny patterns hanging from their hats
or coats like pins.
Their leader, Jack Grey, was the state sheriff of Dallas and had
a happy, harmonious family life after the war. His wife and
kids were the most important thing to him. However, his
happiness was short-lived when a violent gang tragically killed
his family.
The overwhelming guilt over being unable to protect his
family transforms Jack into a different person.
The organization consists of
approximately 100 to 150 people,
including individuals of various
ethnicities, criminals, ex-military
personnel, and mercenaries between
the ages of 20 and 35. They aim to bury
their own free culture beneath their
weapons and past.
Jack'N Boyz is an organization of outlaws
led by the criminal Jack Grey, who
escaped from Fidelia's prison. Most of the
initial members are from the Fidelian
Empire and were sentenced to death
under the strict laws of the empire, but
they escaped with Jack Grey while serving
their sentences.
Fidelion is the first project to be pursued in our IP. With
your NFT as your identity and symbol of Township, we invite
you to a Free-to-play game where you can earn tokens for your
accomplishments.
Scroll & Drag.
Harrier
